page.title: 02VIEWHILL FARM (HORSES)
page.content: An interesting animal kept at Viewhill Farm is the Friesian horse.The Friesian horse of the Netherlands,is always black,dates back some 3000 years and its ancestors are said to have survived The Ice Age.The breed lost favour as a general purpose horse and was actually in danger of dying out.By 1903 there were only three stallions left and in 1978 there were only 26 stallions registered in the Stud book.A new breed society was formed and the numbers have increased to their present level as the Friesian regained popularity.Viewhill Farm, Culloden intends to establish the Friesian in Scotland. The farm has a stallion and 3 brood mares.It has imported 15 colts and intends to sell them to be used at stud.{
